intro: Podanthum sibthorpianum var. tmoleum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed podanthum, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant features slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine pubescence. Its flowers are typically blue or violet, with five lobes, and bloom during the cooler months. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a threatened species.
